snippet: Three executives at the Italian lender were accused of hiding a convoluted derivatives contract that helped it conceal its losses.
abstract: Giuseppe Mussari, Antonio Vigni and Gianluca Baldassarri, former managers of Monte dei Paschi di Siena, are sentenced to jail time and banned from public office for five years; executives are accused of hiding convoluted derivatives contract that helped conceal bank's losses.

byline.original: By GAIA PIANIGIANI and JACK EWING

lead_paragraph: Three executives at the Italian lender were accused of hiding a convoluted derivatives contract that helped it conceal its losses.

headline.main: Monte dei Paschi di Siena’s Former Executives Sentenced to 3.5 Years in Prison
headline.print_headline: Monte dei Paschi Executives Get 3.5 Years in Prison

keywords.value: Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA
keywords.name: organizations
